text: Chicago Tribune is a major newspaper in Chicago, Illinois. It was founded on June 10, 1847 by James Kelly, John E. Wheeler, and Joseph K. C. Forrest. The Tribune ran the wrong result in its headline, "DEWEY DEFEATS TRUMAN" during the 1948 United States presidential election. == References == ==Other websites== *Official website Category:1847 establishments in the United States Tribune Category:1840s establishments in Illinois
title: Chicago Tribune
